page.title: 19OTHAM AND ITS LAND USES
page.content: Otham, in sq.7953, is a small linear village, with 957 people living in its parish in 1981. A major land use is the growing of{fruit}such as apples, strawberries and raspberries, but{ {cereals}and{vegetables}occupy some fields. The rest is mostly{pasture,} near the banks of the small River Len north of the village. In the north-west new private housing estates, called Downswood and The Spires,are being built on the sites of ragstone{quarries.}Only three minor roads run into Otham, and the only amenities are a{post office, village {hall, public house and village green.} The former primary school is now a private residence. Each weekday the southern end of the village is served by{4 buses}into Maidstone, and 4 from Maidstone.
